dct_title_s: Nouvelle mappe-monde, recemment mise en lumiere
dct_description_sm: California shown as a labeled island with a nearly flat northern coast with one small indentation. Includes place names. Depicts small islands between California and the North American continent. The Baja Peninsula is shown next to the northern half of the island of California. A coastline of Nova Albion is depicted with place names, including Cape Mendocino on the far left. Cape Mendocino is also labeled on the northern coast of California.
Includes the beginning of New Zealand's coastline.
Title on banner at map center top. Map surrounded by vignettes depicting seasonal scenes on all sides with a central top vignette of an open book.
Includes a water mark MIC (western hemisphere) and a Fleur de Lys motif (eastern hemisphere).
dct_rights_sm: Image from the Glen McLaughlin Map Collection of California as an Island courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
